page.title: 07The Wem Brewery 1
page.content: Brewing first started in Wem around 1700.It became the Wem Brewery combine in 1898 and took over the EIIesmere Brewery in 1935.Greenall Whitley bought Wem Brewery in 1952 and also bought the Wrekin Brewery in 1966. The main offices have always been at Wem. All these companies together now form Wem Brewery and it has 200 pubs.The sign is a wooden malt shovel taken from one that still stands on the top of the malting chimney.This depicts the main ingredient of the beer and that is malt. The brewery is one of Wem's biggest empoyers. There are 50 process workers and 30 sales and administration staff in Wem Brewery itself and 20 managers and over 1300 staff in pubs around the area served. 10 delivery vehicles and several vans distribute the beer.
